tool.name: SAGA.ta_morphometry.15
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayDEM False isArrayDIR False isArrayLEN False output_data_EFFECT $output_data_EFFECT output_data_AFH $output_data_AFH name SAGA.ta_morphometry.15 DEM $DEM DIR $DIR DIR_UNITS $DIR_UNITS LEN $LEN LEN_SCALE $LEN_SCALE MAXDIST $MAXDIST DIR_CONST $DIR_CONST OLDVER $OLDVER ACCEL $ACCEL PYRAMIDS $PYRAMIDS prefer $prefer response $response outputType_EFFECT $OutputSection_EFFECT.outputType_EFFECT transmissionMode_EFFECT $OutputSection_EFFECT.transmissionMode_EFFECT outputType_AFH $OutputSection_AFH.outputType_AFH transmissionMode_AFH $OutputSection_AFH.transmissionMode_AFH

param.name: DEM
param.label: Elevation
param.help: Elevation The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-aaigrid, x-ogc-envi, tiff, png

param.name: DIR
param.label: Wind Direction
param.help: Direction into which the wind blows, starting with 0 for North and increasing clockwise. The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-aaigrid, x-ogc-envi, tiff, png

param.name: LEN
param.label: Wind Speed
param.help: Wind Speed The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-aaigrid, x-ogc-envi, tiff, png

param.name: DIR_CONST
param.label: Constant Wind Direction
param.help: constant direction into the wind blows, given as degree

param.name: OLDVER
param.label: Old Version
param.help: use old version for constant wind direction (no acceleration and averaging option)

param.name: PYRAMIDS
param.label: Elevation Averaging
param.help: use more averaged elevations when looking at increasing distances

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_EFFECT
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

section.name: OutputSection_AFH
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

tool.help: The 'Wind Effect' is a dimensionless index. Values below 1 indicate wind shadowed areas whereas values above 1 indicate areas exposed to wind, all with regard to the specified wind direction. Wind direction, i.e. the direction into which the wind blows, might be either constant or variying in space, if a wind direction grid is supplied.
